alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 3:30PM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: ...Fast moving squall approaching the Lower and Middle Keys... At 324 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a fast moving squall along a line extending from near Mahogany Hammock to near Shark Key to 31 miles southwest of Boca Grande Key. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. This squall is currently moving through Key West and a wind gust of 45 mph was reported at the Coast Guard station in Key West. This squall is expected to arrive in Marathon at around 400 pm. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Key West, Marathon, Bahia Honda Channel Bridge, Seven Mile Bridge, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Big Coppitt Key, Boca Chica Channel Bridge, Niles Channel Bridge, Spanish Harbor Channel Bridge and Boca Chica. This includes US 1 between mile markers 0 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys
